forms.title: Spend in the last reporting period

grant.description: Funding to help local cheesemongers provide samples to park visitors, with the intention to increase the local community's satisfaction with the variety and quality of local cheeses.
grant.name: Cheeseboards in parks

questions.name: lead contact name
questions.text: What is the full name of the lead contact for this programme?

questions.name: lead contact email
questions.text: What is the email address of the lead contact for this programme?

questions.data_type: Select one from a list of choices
questions.name: lead contact role
questions.text: What is the role of the lead contact for this programme?

questions.data_type: Select one from a list of choices
questions.name: kind of data certifier
questions.text: What kind of data certifier is the lead contact?

questions.name: lead contact's custom role
questions.text: What is the lead contact's role in your own words?

questions.name: programme website
questions.text: What is the website for this programme?

questions.data_type: Select one from a list of choices
questions.name: lead contact's London borough
questions.text: In which London borough is the lead contact based?

questions.text: On which days of the week is the lead contact based in London?

questions.text: Provide a brief update on the progress of your programme

questions.text: Describe the main success that your programme had in the last reporting period

questions.text: How many cheesemongers did you support in the last reporting period?

questions.hint: Enter a percentage score between 0 and 100
questions.name: park visitor satifaction
questions.text: What percentage of park visitors are happy with the local cheeses produced in the community?

questions.name: explanation for low satisfaction
questions.text: Why is park visitor satisfaction so low?

questions.name: risk title
questions.text: What is the name of the risk?

questions.hint: Think about what could go wrong, what could happen to cause things to go wrong, and what would the outcome be if it did go wrong
questions.name: risk description
questions.text: Describe the risk in detail

questions.data_type: Select one from a list of choices
questions.name: risk category
questions.text: What is the principle risk category?

questions.data_type: Select one from a list of choices
questions.name: risk status
questions.text: What is the risk status?

questions.hint: This is not compliant with data standards
questions.name: risk owner
questions.text: Who is the risk owner?

questions.name: risk to life
questions.text: Is there a risk to life?

questions.name: management of risk to life
questions.text: How are you managing the risk to life?

questions.data_type: Select one from a list of choices
questions.name: current risk impact score
questions.text: What is the current impact score?

questions.data_type: Select one from a list of choices
questions.name: current risk likelihood score
questions.text: What is the current likelihood score?

questions.name: current risk mitigations
questions.text: What current mitigations are in place for the risk?

questions.name: planned risk mitigations
questions.text: What planned mitigations are there for the risk?

questions.data_type: Select one from a list of choices
questions.name: target risk impact score
questions.text: What is the target impact score?

questions.data_type: Select one from a list of choices
questions.name: target risk likelihood score
questions.text: What is the target likelihood score?

questions.hint: The target total risk score is calculated by multiplying the likelihood by the impact. Note: custom conditions would let this to be branched away from.
questions.name: high target total risk score justification
questions.text: If the target total risk score is over 20, explain why

questions.name: spend in the last reporting period
questions.text: How much did you spend in the last reporting period?

questions.name: reason why the spend was so low
questions.text: Why was the spend so low?

questions.name: reason why the spend was so high
questions.text: Why was the spend so high?

questions.hint: If you have overspent, enter a negative number
questions.name: unspent allocated funding
questions.text: How much of your allocated funding for the last reporting period remains unspent?

questions.name: explanation for overspend
questions.text: Provide an explanation for the overspend

questions.hint: The next reporting period is October 2025 to April 2026
questions.name: expected future spend
questions.text: How much do you expect to spend in the next reporting period?

questions.text: Do you have enough remaining allocated funding to meet your expected future spend?
